SpatMCA 1.0.2.5

  • Changelog

SpatMCA

Description

SpatMCA is an R package that provides regularized maximum covariance analysis,

  • identifying smooth and localized couple patterns to understand how one spatial process is affected by another
  • suitable for either regularly or irregularly spaced data, including 1D, 2D, and 3D
  • by the alternating direction method of multipliers (ADMM) algorithm

Installation

To get the current development version from GitHub:

devtools::install_github("egpivo/SpatMCA")

To compile C++ code with the package RcppArmadillo,

  • Windows users require Rtools
  • Mac users require Xcode Command Line Tools, and install the library gfortran by typing the following lines into terminal brew update brew install gcc The detailed solution is describd here, or download and install the library gfortran to solve the error ld: library not found for -lgfortran.

Author

Wen-Ting Wang and Hsin-Cheng Huang

Maintainer

Wen-Ting Wang

Reference

Wang, W.-T. and Huang, H.-C. (2017). Regularized spatial maximum covariance analysis, Environmetrics, 29, https://doi.org/10.1002/env.2481
